birdnetTools 0.0.0.9000

Filter BirdNET output data by species, confidence, date, and time

Source: R/birdnet_filter.R
birdnet_filter.Rd

Applies one or more common filtering operations to a BirdNET output dataframe. This includes filtering by species name, confidence threshold, year, date range, and hour range. The function also records the filtering parameters as an attribute (filter_log) attached to the returned dataframe, allowing users to inspect what filters were applied.

Usage

birdnet_filter(
  data,
  species = NULL,
  threshold = NULL,
  year = NULL,
  min_date = NULL,
  max_date = NULL,
  hour = NULL
)

Arguments

data

A data frame containing BirdNET output. Column names will be standardized internally using birdnet_clean_names().

species

Character vector. One or more common names of the species to filter by (e.g., c("Swainson's Thrush", "American Robin")).

threshold

Either a single numeric value between 0 and 1 (for universal threshold) or a data frame with scientific_name and threshold columns for species-specific thresholds. Rows with confidence below the threshold will be excluded.

year

Integer or vector of integers. Year(s) to retain in the data (e.g., c(2024:2025)).

min_date, max_date

Character strings or Date objects specifying the date range (inclusive). If only one is provided, filtering is open-ended on the other side (e.g., "2025-06-09").

hour

Integer vector between 0 and 23 specifying which hours of the day to keep (e.g., c(4:7)).

Value

A filtered data frame with a "filter_log" attribute containing the filtering parameters used.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
filtered <- birdnet_filter(data,
  species = "Swainson's Thrush",
  threshold = 0.75
)
attr(filtered, "filter_log")
} # }
